intro: Laserpitium siler subsp. zernyi, commonly known as the Alpine siler, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, finely divided leaves, and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in alpine and subalpine habitats, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
